learning_outcomes.description: Describe an abstract model of a quantum computer.
Explain how quantum algorithms are constructed, and describe some examples that relate to cryptographic applications.
Describe the fundamental quantum computational complexity classes, and explain how they relate to classical complexity classes such as P and NP.
Describe different ways in which topics from classical computing, coding and cryptography can be adapted to the world of quantum computing.

assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Tutorial/ Problem Set
assessments.task_description: This assignment requires you to solve a set of problems given in class, and to submit your written solutions through Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(22 Jul - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Reading and homework problems

Before and after each lecture and tutorial you are expected to be reading text and other suggested sources for deeper understanding of the material, and trying all homework problems set. This is essential to understand and pass this course -- lectures and tutes alone will not teach you everything you need to know, you are expected to be self-learners in this course.
